chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: This chapter describes the SHR installation.

section.title: Install SHR Image on a SD card
section.para: If you want to install SHR on SD card you should read this section.

section.title: Prepare SD Card
section.para: Before the SD card can be used, it must be partitioned and formatted.
section.bridgehead: Find the device name of the SD card
section.para:
For the further installation process the device name of the SD card must be known. A simple test will provide the name.
Please open a terminal (also known as console) as normal user.
Type in cat /proc/partitions, this will print the list of currently known devices and partitions. An output may look like this:
nschle85@dual-wohnzimmer:~$ cat /proc/partitions major minor #blocks name
8 64 244198584 sde 8 65 92156841 sde1 8 66 145998720 sde2 8 67 1 sde3 8 69 6040408 sde5 nschle85@dual-wohnzimmer:~$
Now plug the SD card into the SD card reader and type again: cat /proc/partitions
Now compare the result of previous output with the current output:
nschle85@dual-wohnzimmer:~$ cat /proc/partitions major minor #blocks name
8 64 244198584 sde 8 65 92156841 sde1 8 66 145998720 sde2 8 67 1 sde3 8 69 6040408 sde5 8 80 7977472 sdf 8 81 7976021 sdf1 nschle85@dual-wohnzimmer:~$
In this case
8 80 7977472 sdf 8 81 7976021 sdf1
was the difference between both outputs. So the device name of the SD card is /dev/sdf.

section.title: Partition the SD Card
section.para: In the previous example the SD card contained one partition. Please configure your SD card to have one partition using the whole space.

section.title: Create file system on the SD Card
section.para:
One choice is to use EXT3 file system. It''s a journaling file system, so a power loss of your phone should not destroy all your saved data.
Please use this file system only on your SD card because it writes very often on SD card and that is not what flash memory is made for. But SD cards are very cheap, and destroying internal flash is very expensive.
To format your SD card execute:
Please check, that you are using the right partition name ! If you use the wrong partition, you may loose important data !
nschle85@dual-wohnzimmer:~$ sudo mkfs.ext3 /dev/sdf1

section.title: Copy SHR Image onto SD card
section.para:
Now you are ready to mount your SD card partition (please create the mount point before)and copy your SHR image to your SD card:
nschle85@dual-wohnzimmer:~$ sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/sdf1 /mnt/sdf1 nschle85@dual-wohnzimmer:~$ sudo tar -C /mnt/sdf1 -xzf /path/to/your/image/lite-om-gta02.tar.gz
